contextId.information: These two phrases have similar meaning and are used together to emphasize that he would not pay any attention to Joram. AT: "I would not have anything at all to do with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: I would not pay any attention to you, or even look at you

contextId.information: Both of these sentences urge Yahweh to pay attention to the things that Sennacherib is saying. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
contextId.quote: Turn your ear, Yahweh, and listen. Open your eyes, Yahweh, and see
